ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FMDkM:ref

Good morning, 

I had the issue today with the version 3.0.3.1009 starting 8:50 until 9:00. 

I isolated the data from the log file called EPPSSLSPLIT.LOG and it appears that this famous message is very present during this timeframe

"007d7840 1276.589 Connection not found in NAT state table, aborting connection"

It doesn't appear before 8:50 and doesn't appear either after 9:00. 

If you could please check this file EPP-Logs-13-Nov-2024.log which is very small and contains relevant data

Best Regards, 
Yacine
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #420107 - Certificate status switch to status Available = NO and Status = NO after restart for no reason

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Date: Thursday, 28 November 2024 at 06:38
To: Yacine Boumekik <yacine.boumekik@hqla-x.com>
Subject: RE: 00420107 - Certificate status switch to status Available = NO and Status = NO after restart for no reason
Hello Yacine,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00420107. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00420107
Ticket Subject: Certificate status switch to status Available = NO and Status = NO after restart for no reason
Ticket Details: Dear partner,

Since a few days we have for specific user S/N : LRLY71T09K a problem. It appears that suddenly in the morning he can't browse any website at all not matter what is the browser he uses (Safari, Firefox, Chrome). The pages keeps loading but ultimately get an error.

However, when i tried on his MacBook some command on the Terminal like CURL, PING -T or TRACEROUTE i was able to see some results and to reach the website destination.

After some time investigating, i finally noticed that the Certificate status of EndPoint Protector certificate status is now marked as NO and the Trusted status is NO but only in the client application. On the server side, the status of the certificate was marked as Trusted.

After a simple restart it worked fine and everything was back to normal. However after a few days the issue came back. Same behavior and same consequences. I investigated a bit more and tried to remove the Endpoint Protector transparent proxy and suddenly web browsing started to work again.

So it's definitly related to this. Immeditaly after removed the EP transparent proxy i had this pop-up telling me that EP wants to add Proxy configuration so that all network activity on this Mac could be filtered and monitored.

This user in our dashboard is called Matti’s MacBook Air and he has the same configuration as everyone one. We apply the same global policy to all of our users.

Do you have any idea of where it comes froms and how to solve it ? Also do you have any client which is impacted by this issue that appeared suddently ten days ago ?

Thank you!

Andrei Pop
Technical Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com<https://www.netwrix.com/>
